thread.title: Meet the astronauts at Novato Space Festival
thread.title_full: Meet the astronauts at Novato Space Festival - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Christine Delsol
title: Meet the astronauts at Novato Space Festival
text:
Photo: Space Station Museum print_article_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|1 email_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|5 google_share_embed|photo-8288930|article-6387693|6 Astronaut Dan Bursch talks to young visitors at the Novato Space Festival in 2014. Astronaut Dan Bursch talks to young visitors at the Novato Space...
You don’t have to go to Houston or Cape Canaveral to rub elbows with astronauts or inspect a lunar module and a moon buggy. Visitors can do that and more during the Novato Space Festival, sponsored by the city’s Space Station Museum. Apollo 15 astronaut Al Worden and space shuttle astronauts Jerry Ross, Yvonne Cagle, Rhea Seddon, Hoot Gibson and Don Bursch will be on hand to answer questions. Bursch and several other astronauts serve on the board of advisers for the museum, which boasts one of the largest collections of space artifacts, such as a Soviet-era cosmonaut flight suit, International Space Station equipment, a space shuttle hatch, photos and models. (The lunar module and moon buggy are replicas.) Astronaut Dan Bursch talks to young visitors at the Novato Space Festival in 2014. Astronaut Dan Bursch talks to young visitors at the Novato Space...
You don’t have to go to Houston or Cape Canaveral to rub elbows with astronauts or inspect a lunar module and a moon buggy. Visitors can do that and more during the Novato Space Festival, sponsored by the city’s Space Station Museum. Apollo 15 astronaut Al Worden and space shuttle astronauts Jerry Ross, Yvonne Cagle, Rhea Seddon, Hoot Gibson and Don Bursch will be on hand to answer questions. Bursch and several other astronauts serve on the board of advisers for the museum, which boasts one of the largest collections of space artifacts, such as a Soviet-era cosmonaut flight suit, International Space Station equipment, a space shuttle hatch, photos and models. (The lunar module and moon buggy are replicas.)
